Blog.post: WHAT WE ARE TRYING TO ACCOMPLISH Three movies shot back to back. Total budget under $5,000,000. Maybe stars but recognizable faces. Crew & Talent fully paid One Kid's Film - urlLink Becoming Tomorrow One Horror Film - urlLink The Wind Cries Mary One Independant - urlLink A Stage Three Shorts & Music Videos - for promotions and DVD Why three at once? To save a serious amount of money. Budgets aren't finished yet but the savings equal out to be about 2.5 million. Also when you make three, you have a better chance of selling one. It's the law of averages. Why these genres? They sell better whether or not a star is involved. Questions? urlLink Ask me

My dad had to go to Orlando again for business. He'll be out for about a week. it would be nice to make a trip out there. I haven't had a real trip anywhere (other than vegas) for about six years. It might not like seem like a big deal to a lot of people but from about when I was 17 to when i turned 21, I only spent about 4 weeks in any area that could be called home. I was out doing theater. Been thinking about that lately.

After a year at the Hard Rock Cafe at Universal Citywalk, I quit my job. The short version of the story is this. I was being asked to do more and more hard labor for less money. Ah well, I'll find something up here that's a little less on the gas tank.
Got word back from Sallie Mae. I only got approved for $10,000 for school. Keybank is looking like my saviour more and more each day. I will find out on Monday.

I'm looking into to taking some avid classes at urlLink Video Symphony . They certify you in avid, and their instruction team is top notch. I just need to figure out a way to get the money. I would need around $30,000 to get me through the year.

So I made it through the first round of urlLink project greenlight , but I got cut in the next round. I'm probably going to put up a page where people can check the work out. It was a little heartbreaking but that's show business.

So I volunteered to do the demo reel for special effects group Captive Audience. I thought I was doing well, but do to an unfortunate error in miscommunication, they thought it better that one of their in-house fx guys finish the reel. You know in my whole 6 years as an editor that was the first time that I've ever been fired. Oy! It's fine though, I am still on good terms. I'm even going to be doing their website.
